longTitle.name: longTitle
longTitle.content: An Ordinance to regulate the provision and obtaining of assistance in criminal matters between Hong Kong and places outside Hong Kong; and for matters incidental thereto or connected therewith.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Short title and commencement

subsection.content: This Ordinance may be cited as the Mutual Legal Assistance in Criminal Matters Ordinance.

This Ordinance shall come into operation on a day to be appointed by the Secretary for Security by notice in the Gazette, and different days may be so appointed for different provisions (including the provisions of Schedule 3).

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: In this Ordinance, unless the context otherwise requires—

def.name: AncillaryCriminalMatter
def.leadIn: ancillary criminal matter (附帶刑事事宜) means a matter relating to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the restraining of dealing with, or the seizure, forfeiture or confiscation of, property in connection with a Hong Kong offence or an external offence; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the obtaining, enforcement or satisfaction of a Hong Kong confiscation order or an external confiscation order;

def.name: AppropriateAuthority
def.leadIn: appropriate authority (有關當局), in relation to a place outside Hong Kong, means a person whom the Secretary for Justice is satisfied is a person who for the time being may under the law of that place— (Amended L.N. 362 of 1997)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a request by Hong Kong to that place for assistance in a criminal matter, receive such a request; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a request by that place to Hong Kong for assistance in a criminal matter, make such a request;

def.name: ArrangementsForMutualLegalAssistance
def.leadIn: arrangements for mutual legal assistance (相互法律協助的安排) means arrangements—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: which are applicable to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the Government and the government of a place outside Hong Kong (other than the Central People’s Government or the government of any other part of the People’s Republic of China); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: Hong Kong and a place outside Hong Kong (other than any other part of the People’s Republic of China); and (Amended 71 of 1999 s. 3)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for the purposes of the provision and obtaining of assistance in criminal matters between Hong Kong and that place;

subsection.def: assistance (協助) includes giving evidence;

def.name: AuthorizedOfficer
def.leadIn: authorized officer (獲授權人員) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any police officer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any member of the Customs and Excise Service established by section 3 of the Customs and Excise Service Ordinance (Cap. 342);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any officer within the meaning of section 2 of the Independent Commission Against Corruption Ordinance (Cap. 204); and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any other person (including a person belonging to a class of persons) authorized in writing by the Secretary for Justice for the purposes of this Ordinance; (Amended L.N. 362 of 1997)

def.name: CriminalMatter
def.leadIn: criminal matter (刑事事宜) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an investigation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a prosecution; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an ancillary criminal matter;

def.name: Dealing
def.leadIn: dealing (處理), in relation to property, includes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: receiving or acquiring the property;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: concealing or disguising the property (whether by concealing or disguising its nature, source, location, disposition, movement or ownership or any rights with respect to it or otherwise);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: disposing of or converting the property;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: bringing into or removing from Hong Kong the property;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: using the property to borrow money, or as security (whether by way of charge, mortgage or pledge or otherwise);

subsection.def: duly certified (妥為核證) means (except in sections 29 and 30) duly certified as provided in section 32;

def.name: ExternalConfiscationOrder
def.leadIn: external confiscation order (外地沒收令) means an order, made under the law of a place outside Hong Kong, for the purpose of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: recovering (including forfeiting and confiscating)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: payments or other rewards received in connection with an external serious offence or their value;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: property derived or realised, directly or indirectly, from payments or other rewards received in connection with an external serious offence or the value of such property; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: property used or intended to be used in connection with an external serious offence or the value of such property; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: depriving a person of a pecuniary advantage obtained in connection with an external serious offence,

def.continued: and whether the proceedings which gave rise to that order are criminal or civil in nature, and whether those proceedings are in the form of proceedings against a person or property;

def.name: ExternalLawImmunityCertificate
def.leadIn: external law immunity certificate (外地法律豁免權證明書) means a certificate given, or a declaration made, by a place outside Hong Kong or under a law of a place outside Hong Kong certifying or declaring that, under the law of that place, persons generally or a specified person could or could not, either generally or in specified proceedings and either generally or in specified circumstances, be required—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to answer a specified question; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to produce a specified document;

subsection.def: external offence (外地罪行) means an offence against a law of a place outside Hong Kong;

def.name: ExternalPrisoner
def.leadIn: external prisoner (外地囚犯) means a person who is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: being held in custody pending trial for or sentence for an external offence; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: under a sentence of imprisonment for an external offence,

def.continued: but does not include a person who is at large having escaped from lawful custody;

subsection.def: external serious offence (外地嚴重罪行) means an external offence the maximum penalty for which is death, or imprisonment for not less than 24 months;

def.name: HongKongConfiscationOrder
def.leadIn: Hong Kong confiscation order (香港沒收令) means an order, made under a law of Hong Kong, for the purpose of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: recovering (including forfeiting or confiscating)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: payments or other rewards received in connection with a Hong Kong serious offence or their value;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: property derived or realised, directly or indirectly, from payments or other rewards received in connection with a Hong Kong serious offence or the value of such property; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: property used or intended to be used in connection with a Hong Kong serious offence or the value of such property; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: depriving a person of a pecuniary advantage obtained in connection with a Hong Kong serious offence,

def.continued: and whether the proceedings which gave rise to that order are criminal or civil in nature, and whether those proceedings are in the form of proceedings against a person or property;

subsection.def: Hong Kong offence (香港罪行) means an offence against a law of Hong Kong;

def.name: HongKongPrisoner
def.leadIn: Hong Kong prisoner (香港囚犯) means a person who is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: being held in custody pending trial for or sentence for a Hong Kong offence; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: under a sentence of imprisonment for a Hong Kong offence,

def.continued: but does not include a person who is at large having escaped from lawful custody;

subsection.def: Hong Kong serious offence (香港嚴重罪行) means a Hong Kong offence the maximum penalty for which is death, or imprisonment for not less than 24 months;

def.name: Investigation
def.leadIn: investigation (偵查) means an investigation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: into a Hong Kong offence or external offence; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for the purposes of an ancillary criminal matter;

subsection.def: Monetary Authority (金融管理專員) means the Monetary Authority appointed under section 5A of the Exchange Fund Ordinance (Cap. 66);

def.name: Premises
def.leadIn: premises (處所) includes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a structure (whether or not movable or offshore), building, tent, vehicle, vessel, aircraft or hovercraft;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a place (whether or not enclosed or built upon); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a part of premises (including premises of a kind referred to in paragraph (a) or (b));

subsection.def: prescribed arrangements (訂明安排) means arrangements for mutual legal assistance which are the subject of an order under section 4(1) which is in force;
prescribed place (訂明地方) means a place outside Hong Kong to or from which assistance in criminal matters may be provided or obtained, as the case may be, pursuant to prescribed arrangements;
prosecution (檢控) means a trial of a person for a Hong Kong offence or external offence, and includes any proceedings to determine whether a person should be tried for such an offence;
relevant auditor (有關核數師) means a person appointed as an auditor for the purposes of any enactment;
statement (陳述) includes evidence;

tax adviser (稅務顧問) means a person appointed bona fide to give advice, in the course of his employment or of a business carried on by him, about the tax affairs of another person (whether appointed directly by that other person or another tax adviser of that other person);

def.name: TaxDocument
def.leadIn: tax document (稅務文件)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a tax adviser, means a document which falls within Part 1 of Schedule 1;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to a relevant auditor, means a document which falls within Part 2 of Schedule 1;

subsection.def: thing (物件) includes material.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the law of a place outside Hong Kong includes the law of any part of that place;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: conduct in—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a colony or dependency; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a vessel, aircraft or hovercraft,

paragraph.continued: of a place outside Hong Kong shall be treated as if the conduct were conduct in the territory of that place.

subsection.leadIn: For the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that any one set of arrangements for mutual legal assistance may be made with any number (including any combination) of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: governments of places outside Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: places outside Hong Kong,

subsection.continued: and the other provisions of this Ordinance (including the definition of arrangements for mutual legal assistance) which relate, whether directly or indirectly, to arrangements for mutual legal assistance shall be construed accordingly.

subsection.leadIn: Where arrangements applicable to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Government and the government of a place outside Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Hong Kong and a place outside Hong Kong,

subsection.continued: are partly for the purposes specified in paragraph (b) of the definition of arrangements for mutual legal assistance and partly for other purposes, the arrangements are in this Ordinance arrangements for mutual legal assistance to the extent that they relate to those specified purposes.

subsection.content: In the definitions of Hong Kong confiscation order and external confiscation order and in subsection (9), any reference to an order includes any order, decree, direction or judgment, or any part thereof, howsoever described.

Where a person obtains a pecuniary advantage referred to in paragraph (b) of the definition of Hong Kong confiscation order or external confiscation order, he is to be treated for the purposes of this Ordinance as if he had obtained in connection with the Hong Kong serious offence or external serious offence, as the case may be, to which the advantage relates a sum of money equal to the value of the advantage, and the other provisions of this Ordinance shall be construed accordingly.

subsection.leadIn: For the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that this Ordinance shall not entitle a private person, or any person acting on behalf of a private person, to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: obtain, suppress or exclude any evidence; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: impede or otherwise prejudice any request under this Ordinance,

subsection.continued: in respect of a criminal matter in Hong Kong or a place outside Hong Kong.

subsection.content: In this Ordinance, any reference (howsoever expressed) to any thing being required to be done, or being done, in relation to a criminal matter also includes a reference to such a thing being required to be done, or being done, in the criminal matter.
In this Ordinance, any reference to an order being made in a proceeding includes a reference to an order arising out of the proceeding.
Subject to subsection (11), nothing in this Ordinance shall require the disclosure of any items subject to legal privilege within the meaning of section 13. (Added 26 of 2002 s. 5)
Subsection (10) shall not prejudice the operation of Part IV. (Added 26 of 2002 s. 5)

section.name: s3
section.heading: Application

subsection.content: This Ordinance shall not apply to the provision or obtaining of assistance in criminal matters between Hong Kong and any other part of the People’s Republic of China. (Amended 71 of 1999 s. 3)

subsection.leadIn: This Ordinance shall not operate to prevent or prejudice the generality of the provision or obtaining of assistance in criminal matters between Hong Kong and a place outside Hong Kong otherwise than—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: as provided for under this Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: pursuant to arrangements for mutual legal assistance.

subsection.content: It is hereby declared that the provisions of this Ordinance shall not operate to prejudice the generality of section 4 of the Inland Revenue Ordinance (Cap. 112).

section.name: s4
section.heading: Chief Executive in Council may apply Ordinance

subsection.content: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), the Chief Executive in Council may, with the approval of the Legislative Council, in relation to any arrangements for mutual legal assistance, by order to which is annexed a copy of the arrangements direct that this Ordinance shall, subject to such modifications thereto as may be specified in the order, apply as between Hong Kong and the place outside Hong Kong to which the arrangements relate. (Amended 71 of 1999 s. 3)

The Chief Executive in Council shall not make an order under subsection (1) unless the arrangements for mutual legal assistance are substantially in conformity with the provisions of this Ordinance. (Amended 71 of 1999 s. 3)
Where an order under subsection (1) specifies modifications referred to in that subsection, the modifications shall be summarized in a Schedule to the order.

subsection.leadIn: An order under subsection (1) may specify that it shall come into operation on a day—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: specified in the order; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to be appointed by the Secretary for Security by notice in the Gazette.

subsection.content: A copy of an order under subsection (1) shall be conclusive evidence that this Ordinance applies in the case of any place outside Hong Kong to which the order relates.

subsection.leadIn: Where any arrangements for mutual legal assistance cease to relate to, or become related to, a place outside Hong Kong, the Chief Executive may, by notice in the Gazette, amend the order under subsection (1) which relates to those arrangements to specify— (Amended 71 of 1999 s. 3)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that those arrangements have ceased to relate to, or have become related to, as the case may be, that place; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date on which the event referred to in paragraph (a) occurred.

subsection.content: Section 35(b) of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1) shall apply to an order under subsection (1) as if for the words “amend the whole or any part” in that section there were substituted the words “repeal the whole”.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Refusal of assistance

subsection.leadIn: A request by a place outside Hong Kong for assistance under this Ordinance shall be refused if, in the opinion of the Secretary for Justice—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the granting of the request would impair the sovereignty of the People’s Republic of China or the security or public order of the People’s Republic of China or any part thereof; (Amended 71 of 1999 s. 3)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the request relates to the prosecution or punishment of a person for an external offence that is, or is by reason of the circumstances in which it is alleged to have been committed or was committed, an offence of a political character;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the request relates to the prosecution or punishment of a person in respect of an act or omission that, if it had occurred in Hong Kong, would have constituted an offence under the military law applicable in Hong Kong but not also under the ordinary criminal law of Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: there are substantial grounds for believing that the request was made for the purpose of prosecuting, punishing or otherwise causing prejudice to a person on account of the person’s race, religion, nationality or political opinions;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the request relates to the prosecution of a person for an external offence in a case where the person has been convicted, acquitted or pardoned by a competent court or other authority in the place, or has undergone the punishment provided by the law of that place, in respect of that offence or of another external offence constituted by the same act or omission as that offence;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the granting of the request would seriously impair the essential interests of Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the request relates to an act or omission that, if it had occurred in Hong Kong, would not have constituted a Hong Kong offence.

subsection.leadIn: Where the criminal matter to which a request by a place outside Hong Kong for assistance under this Ordinance relates is an investigation into an external offence relating to taxation, then the request shall be refused—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the place is not a prescribed place; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: unless the Secretary for Justice is supplied with information that satisfies him that the primary purpose of the request is not the assessment or collection of tax.

subsection.leadIn: A request by a place outside Hong Kong for assistance under this Ordinance may be refused by the Secretary for Justice—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if that place is not a prescribed place;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if that place is a prescribed place, pursuant to the terms of the prescribed arrangements concerned; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: if the request relates to an external serious offence punishable with death and—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: the act or omission constituting that offence, if it had occurred in Hong Kong—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: would not have constituted a Hong Kong serious offence punishable with death; or

subparagraph.name: B
ii
subparagraph.content: the place outside Hong Kong concerned fails to give an undertaking that satisfies the Secretary for Justice that the death penalty will not be imposed in respect of that external serious offence or, if imposed, will not be carried out.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to the generality of subsection (3)(a), a request by a place outside Hong Kong for assistance under this Ordinance shall be refused if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the place is not a prescribed place; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the appropriate authority of the place fails to give an undertaking to the Secretary for Justice which satisfies the Secretary for Justice that the place will, subject to its law, comply with a future request by Hong Kong to the place for assistance in a criminal matter.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Assistance may be provided subject to conditions
section.content: Assistance under this Ordinance may be provided to a place outside Hong Kong subject to such conditions as the Secretary for Justice determines but, if that place is a prescribed place, no such conditions shall be inconsistent with any provision of the prescribed arrangements between Hong Kong and that place.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Requests for assistance by Hong Kong
section.content: A request by Hong Kong to a place outside Hong Kong for assistance in a criminal matter may be made by the Secretary for Justice.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Requests for assistance to Hong Kong

subsection.content: A request by a place outside Hong Kong to Hong Kong for assistance in a criminal matter may be made to the Secretary for Justice. (Amended L.N. 362 of 1997)

subsection.leadIn: A request under subsection (1) shall be accompanied by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of the authority concerned with the criminal matter to which the request relates;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a description of the nature of the criminal matter (in particular, details of the external offence to which the criminal matter relates) and a statement setting out a summary of the relevant facts and laws;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a description of the purpose of the request and of the nature of the assistance being sought;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: details of the procedure that the place outside Hong Kong concerned wishes to be followed by Hong Kong in giving effect to the request, including details of the manner and form in which any information, document or thing is to be supplied to the place pursuant to the request;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a statement setting out the wishes of the place concerning the confidentiality of the request and the reason for those wishes;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: details of the period within which the place wishes the request be complied with;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: if the request involves a person travelling from Hong Kong to the place, details of allowances to which the person will be entitled, and of the arrangements for accommodation for the person, while the person is in the place pursuant to the request;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: a statement setting out the maximum penalty for the external offence to which the criminal matter relates; and

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: any other information that may assist in giving effect to the request.

part.name: P2
part.heading: Assistance in Relation to Taking of Evidence and Production of Things

section.name: s9
section.heading: Requests by Hong Kong for taking of evidence, etc.

subsection.leadIn: The Secretary for Justice may request an appropriate authority of a place outside Hong Kong to arrange for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: evidence to be taken in the place and the transmission of the evidence to Hong Kong; (Amended 23 of 2003 s. 19)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: evidence to be taken by way of a live audio-visual link from a person at the place; or (Added 23 of 2003 s. 19. Amended 6 of 2025 s. 74)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a thing (including a thing belonging to a class of things) in the place to be produced and the transmission of the thing to Hong Kong,

subsection.continued: for the purposes of a criminal matter in Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: The provisions of sections 77F and 77G of the Evidence Ordinance (Cap. 8) shall, with all necessary modifications, apply to and in relation to any deposition, together with any thing exhibited or annexed thereto, which is received by the Secretary for Justice pursuant to a request under subsection (1) as if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that request were a letter of request issued by the Registrar of the High Court under section 77E of that Ordinance; (Amended 25 of 1998 s. 2)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that deposition, together with any thing exhibited or annexed thereto, were received by that Registrar pursuant to such letter; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: any references in those provisions to criminal proceedings were references to—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
iii
subparagraph.content: where the criminal matter concerned is an ancillary criminal matter, the ancillary criminal matter,

subsection.continued: and the other provisions of that Ordinance, or of any other Ordinance, which relate, whether directly or indirectly, to sections 77F and 77G of the Evidence Ordinance (Cap. 8) shall be construed accordingly.

subsection.content: In this section, any reference to a deposition includes a reference to an affidavit, affirmation or declaration made under an obligation to state the truth according to the law of the place where the affidavit, affirmation or declaration is made. (Added 18 of 2014 s. 50)

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (1)—
subsection.def: live audio-visual link (音視直播聯繫) has the meaning given by section 2 of the Courts (Remote Hearing) Ordinance (6 of 2025). (Replaced 6 of 2025 s. 74)

section.name: s10
section.heading: Requests to Hong Kong for taking of evidence, etc.

subsection.leadIn: Where a request is made by an appropriate authority of a place outside Hong Kong that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: evidence be taken in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: evidence be taken by way of a live audio-visual link from a person in Hong Kong; or (Amended 6 of 2025 s. 75)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a thing (including a thing belonging to a class of things) in Hong Kong be produced,

subsection.continued: for the purposes of a criminal matter in the place, the Secretary for Justice may authorize in writing—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: where paragraph (a) applies, the taking of evidence and the transmission of the evidence to that place;

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: where paragraph (b) applies, the taking of evidence by way of a live audio-visual link from the person concerned; or (Amended 6 of 2025 s. 75)

paragraph.name: iii
paragraph.content: where paragraph (c) applies, the production of the thing and, subject to subsection (14), the transmission of the thing to that place. (Replaced 23 of 2003 s. 20)

subsection.leadIn: Where the Secretary for Justice authorizes the taking of evidence or the production of a thing under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of the taking of evidence under subsection (1)(i), a magistrate may take the evidence on oath or otherwise than on oath of each witness appearing before the magistrate to give evidence in relation to the matter, and a magistrate who takes any such evidence shall— (Amended 23 of 2003 s. 20)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: cause the evidence to be put in writing and certify that the evidence was taken by the magistrate; and

subparagraph.name: ii

paragraph.name: aa
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of the taking of evidence under subsection (1)(ii), a magistrate shall be present during the taking of the evidence and the magistrate shall—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: identify the witness;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: upon the conclusion of the taking of the evidence, draw up minutes indicating the date on which the evidence is taken, the place where the evidence is taken, and whether or not an oath or affirmation has been administered to the witness;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: certify that the minutes were drawn up by the magistrate; and

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: cause the minutes so certified to be sent to the Secretary for Justice; or (Added 23 of 2003 s. 20)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of the production of a thing under subsection (1)(iii), a magistrate may require the production of the thing and, where the thing is produced, the magistrate shall certify that the thing was produced to the magistrate and shall send the thing (which, in the case of a document, may be a copy of the document certified by the magistrate to be a true copy) to the Secretary for Justice. (Amended L.N. 362 of 1997; 23 of 2003 s. 20)

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: A magistrate may only take the evidence of a witness under subsection (2)(a) otherwise than on oath where this is asked for by the appropriate authority of the place outside Hong Kong. (Added 23 of 2003 s. 20)

subsection.leadIn: A proceeding under subsection (2) shall be held in open court except where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the magistrate is satisfied that it is necessary for the proceeding to be held in camera in order to comply with any prescribed arrangements relating to the proceeding;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the magistrate exercises a power pursuant to the provisions of any other Ordinance whereby he may hold the proceeding in camera; (Amended 23 of 2003 s. 20)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the criminal matter outside Hong Kong to which the proceeding relates is an investigation and the magistrate is satisfied that there are reasonable grounds for believing that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: it is in the interest of the person required to give evidence, or produce a thing, for the purposes of that matter that the proceeding be held in camera; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: that matter would be substantially prejudiced if the proceeding were held in open court; or (Amended 23 of 2003 s. 20)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of the taking of evidence under subsection (1)(ii)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the criminal matter outside Hong Kong to which the proceeding relates is a prosecution;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the appropriate authority of the place concerned requests that the proceeding be held in camera; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the proceedings in the place concerned in which the evidence is to be received will be held in camera. (Added 23 of 2003 s. 20)

subsection.leadIn: The magistrate conducting a proceeding under subsection (2) shall permit—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person to whom the criminal matter in the place outside Hong Kong concerned relates;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other person giving evidence or producing a thing at the proceeding before the magistrate; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the appropriate authority of that place,

subsection.continued: to appear, or have legal representation, or both, at the proceeding before the magistrate.

subsection.leadIn: The certificate by the magistrate under subsection (2) shall state whether, when the evidence was taken or the thing was produced, any of the following persons were present—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person to whom the criminal matter in the place outside Hong Kong concerned relates or his legal representative, if any;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other person giving evidence or producing a thing or his legal representative, if any.

subsection.content: For the purposes of this section, the person to whom the criminal matter in the place outside Hong Kong concerned relates is competent but not compellable to give evidence.

For the purposes of this section, a person who is required to give evidence, or produce a thing, for the purposes of a criminal matter in a place outside Hong Kong, is not compellable to answer a question, or produce a thing, that the person is not compellable to answer or produce, as the case may be, in the criminal matter in that place.
A duly certified external law immunity certificate is admissible in proceedings under this section as evidence of the facts stated in the certificate.
Subsection (7) does not apply in a case where its application would be inconsistent with any provision of prescribed arrangements, if any, between Hong Kong and the prescribed place concerned.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section, a person who is required to give evidence, or produce a thing, for the purposes of a criminal matter in a place outside Hong Kong, is not compellable to give evidence, or produce a thing, that the person could not be compelled to give or produce, as the case may be, in Hong Kong—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn: without prejudice to the generality of paragraph (a)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: on the ground that to do so might tend to incriminate him; and

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the provisions of any Ordinance which qualify a person’s right not to incriminate himself had never been enacted; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: that matter were a trial of a person for a Hong Kong offence or proceedings to determine whether a person should be tried for such an offence.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to the generality of subsection (10), for the purposes of this section, a tax adviser or relevant auditor who is required to give evidence, or produce a thing, for the purposes of a criminal matter in a place outside Hong Kong which is an investigation into an external offence relating to taxation, is not compellable to give evidence, or produce a thing, to the extent that the evidence or thing, as the case may be, relates to, or is, a tax document which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is the property of that tax adviser or relevant auditor, as the case may be; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a tax adviser, originates from him, or from his client or another tax adviser of the client, for or in connection with the giving or obtaining of advice about the tax affairs of the client.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section, and without prejudice to the operation of subsection (6), (7), (9), (10) or (11), a person who is required to give evidence, or produce a thing, for the purposes of a criminal matter in a place outside Hong Kong, shall not be required—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to state what things relevant to that matter are or have been in his possession or control; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to produce any things other than particular things specified by the magistrate conducting the proceedings concerned under subsection (2), or things belonging to a particular class of things specified by that magistrate, as being things, or a class of things, as the case may be, appearing to that magistrate to be, or to be likely to be, in his possession or control.

subsection.content: It is hereby declared that evidence taken for the purposes of this section shall not be admissible in evidence, or otherwise used, for the purposes of any criminal matter, civil proceedings, disciplinary proceedings, or other proceedings, in Hong Kong except any prosecution of the person who gave that evidence for the offence of perjury, or contempt of court, in respect of that evidence.

subsection.leadIn: The Secretary for Justice shall not authorize under subsection (1) the transmission of the original of a thing to a place outside Hong Kong unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the appropriate authority of the place has, not more than 1 month after the thing was produced, given the Secretary for Justice a notice in writing setting out the grounds on which the original of the thing is required for the purposes of the criminal matter concerned in that place; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any case where the Secretary for Justice is of the opinion, after considering all the circumstances, that the original of the thing should be returned to Hong Kong upon the conclusion of the proceedings relating to that criminal matter, the appropriate authority has given an unqualified undertaking to the Secretary for Justice that the original of the thing will be so returned. (Amended L.N. 362 of 1997)

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: live audio-visual link (音視直播聯繫) has the meaning given by section 2 of the Courts (Remote Hearing) Ordinance (6 of 2025). (Replaced 6 of 2025 s. 75)

part.name: P3
part.heading: Assistance in Relation to Search and Seizure

section.name: s11
section.heading: Requests by Hong Kong for search and seizure

subsection.content: This section applies to a criminal matter involving a Hong Kong serious offence if there are reasonable grounds to believe that a thing (including a thing belonging to a class of things) relevant to the criminal matter may be located in a place outside Hong Kong.

Where this section applies to a criminal matter, the Secretary for Justice may request an appropriate authority of the place outside Hong Kong concerned to, in accordance with the law of that place, search for a thing relevant to the criminal matter, and, if such a thing, or any other thing that is or may be relevant to the criminal matter is found pursuant to such a search, the seizure of that thing and its onward transmission to Hong Kong. (Amended L.N. 362 of 1997)

section.name: s12
section.heading: Requests to Hong Kong for search and seizure

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a criminal matter involving an external serious offence has commenced in a place outside Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: there are reasonable grounds to believe that a thing (including a thing belonging to a class of things) relevant to the criminal matter is located in Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an appropriate authority of that place requests the Secretary for Justice to arrange for the issue of a search warrant under this section in relation to that thing,

subsection.continued: the Secretary for Justice may nominate in writing an authorized officer to apply to a magistrate for the search warrant so requested. (Amended L.N. 362 of 1997)

subsection.leadIn: Where an authorized officer nominated under subsection (1) has reason to believe that the thing to which the request relates is, or will, at a specified time, be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on a person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the clothing that is being worn by a person;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: otherwise in a person’s effective control;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: upon any land; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: upon or in any premises,

subsection.continued: the relevant officer may—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: lay before a magistrate an information on oath setting out the grounds for that belief; and

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: apply for the issue of a warrant under this section.

subsection.leadIn: Where an application is made under subsection (2), the magistrate shall, subject to subsection (4), issue a warrant authorizing an authorized officer (whether or not named in the warrant), with such assistance, and by such force, as is necessary and reasonable to do such of the following as are specified in the warrant—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to search a person specified in the warrant for the thing;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to enter upon land, or upon or into premises, specified in the warrant;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to search any such land or premises for the thing; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: to seize any thing found in the course of any such search that the relevant officer believes, on reasonable grounds, to be relevant to the criminal matter in the place outside Hong Kong concerned.

subsection.leadIn: A magistrate shall not issue a warrant under this section unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the informant or some other person has given to the magistrate either orally on oath or by affidavit, such further information, if any, as the magistrate requires concerning the grounds on which the issue of the warrant is sought; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the magistrate is satisfied that there are reasonable grounds for issuing the warrant.

subsection.leadIn: There shall be stated in a warrant issued under this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the purpose for which the warrant is issued, including a reference to the nature of the criminal matter in relation to which the search is authorized;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether the search is authorized at any time of the day or night or during specified hours of the day or night;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a description of the kind of things authorized to be seized; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a day, not being later than 1 month after the issue of the warrant, on which the warrant ceases to have effect. (Amended E.R. 1 of 2019)

subsection.leadIn: If, in the course of searching, under a warrant issued under this section, for a thing of a kind specified in the warrant, the authorized officer finds another thing that the authorized officer believes on reasonable grounds—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to be relevant to the criminal matter in the place outside Hong Kong concerned or to afford evidence as to the commission of a Hong Kong offence; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is likely to be concealed, lost, destroyed or altered if it is not seized,

subsection.continued: the warrant shall be deemed to authorize the authorized officer to seize the other thing.

subsection.content: Where an authorized officer finds, as a result of a search in accordance with a warrant issued under this section, a thing which the authorized officer seizes wholly or partly because he believes the thing on reasonable grounds to be relevant to the criminal matter in the place outside Hong Kong concerned, the authorized officer shall deliver the thing into the custody and control of the Commissioner.

Where a thing is delivered into the custody and control of the Commissioner under subsection (7), the Commissioner shall arrange for the thing to be kept for a period not exceeding 1 month from the day on which the thing was seized pending a direction in writing from the Secretary for Justice as to the manner in which the thing is to be dealt with (which may include, subject to subsection (11), a direction that the thing be sent to an appropriate authority of a place outside Hong Kong). (Amended L.N. 362 of 1997; E.R. 1 of 2019)

subsection.leadIn: An authorized officer who executes a search warrant issued under this section shall, as soon as practicable after the execution of the warrant, give to the person, or give to the owner or occupier of the land or premises or leave in a prominent position on the land or at the premises, as the case requires—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a notice setting out—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the name and rank of the authorized officer;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the name of the magistrate who issued the warrant and the day on which it was issued; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a description of any thing seized and removed in accordance with the warrant; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of any such thing which is a document, a copy of the document if that person, owner or occupier, as the case may be, so requests.

subsection.leadIn: Where subsection (3)(a) is applicable to a warrant issued under this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an authorized officer acting in accordance with the warrant may remove, or require a person to remove, any of the clothing that the person is wearing but only if the removal of the clothing is necessary and reasonable for an effective search of the person under the warrant;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person shall not be searched pursuant to the warrant except by a person of the same sex;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: nothing in this section shall be taken to authorize an authorized officer to carry out a search by way of an examination of a body cavity of a person;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: an authorized officer may also search—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the clothing that is being worn by a person; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any property in, or apparently in, the person’s effective control.

subsection.leadIn: The Secretary for Justice shall not give a direction under subsection (8) that the original of a thing be sent to the appropriate authority of a place outside Hong Kong unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the appropriate authority of the place has, not more than 1 month after the thing was seized, given the Secretary for Justice a notice in writing setting out the grounds on which the original of the thing is required for the purposes of the criminal matter concerned in that place; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any case where the Secretary for Justice is of the opinion, after considering all the circumstances, that the original of the thing should be returned to Hong Kong upon the conclusion of the proceedings relating to that criminal matter, the appropriate authority has given an unqualified undertaking to the Secretary for Justice that the original of the thing will be so returned. (Amended L.N. 362 of 1997)

def.name: Commissioner
def.leadIn: In this section, Commissioner (部門首長) means, where the authorized officer concerned is an authorized officer by virtue of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: paragraph (a) or (d) of the definition of authorized officer, Commissioner within the meaning of the Police Force Ordinance (Cap. 232);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: paragraph (b) of the definition of authorized officer, Commissioner within the meaning of the Customs and Excise Service Ordinance (Cap. 342);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: paragraph (c) of the definition of authorized officer, Commissioner within the meaning of the Independent Commission Against Corruption Ordinance (Cap. 204).

def.name: Thing
def.leadIn: For the purposes of this section, in the case of a criminal matter in a place outside Hong Kong which is an investigation into an external offence relating to taxation, thing does not include a tax document which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is the property of a tax adviser or relevant auditor; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a tax adviser, originates from him, or from his client or another tax adviser of the client, for or in connection with the giving or obtaining of advice about the tax affairs of the client.

part.name: P4
part.heading: Assistance in Relation to Production, etc. of Material

section.name: s13
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: In this Part—
subsection.def: court (法院) means the Court of First Instance and the District Court; (Amended 25 of 1998 s. 2)

def.name: ItemsSubjectToLegalPrivilege
def.leadIn: items subject to legal privilege (享有法律特權的品目) means—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: communications between a professional legal adviser and his client or any person representing his client or between such an adviser or his client or any such representative and any other person made in connection with or in contemplation of legal proceedings and for the purposes of such proceedings; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: items enclosed with or referred to in such communications and made—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in connection with the giving of legal advice; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in connection with or in contemplation of legal proceedings and for the purposes of such proceedings,

paragraph.continued: when they are in the possession of a person who is entitled to possession of them, but excluding, in any case, any communications or item held with the intention of furthering a criminal purpose.

subsection.leadIn: For the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that the provisions of this Part shall not operate to prejudice the operation of the provisions of Part III and, accordingly—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Secretary for Justice may make a request under section 11 in respect of material whether or not that material is the subject of a request under section 14; (Amended L.N. 362 of 1997)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a place outside Hong Kong may make a request under section 12 in respect of material whether or not that material is the subject of a request under section 15.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Requests by Hong Kong for production, etc. of material

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to a criminal matter involving a Hong Kong serious offence if there are reasonable grounds to believe that particular material or material of a particular description relevant to the criminal matter may be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: located in a place outside Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: likely to become located in a place outside Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: Where this section applies to a criminal matter, the Secretary for Justice may request an appropriate authority of the place outside Hong Kong concerned to obtain an order or other instrument— (Amended L.N. 362 of 1997)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where subsection (1)(a) is applicable, requiring the person who appears to be in possession or control of the material to which the request relates;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where subsection (1)(b) is applicable, requiring the person who appears likely to come into possession or control of the material to which the request relates, when the person comes into possession or control of any such material,

subsection.continued: to—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.leadIn: produce the material for the purposes of—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: its onward transmission to Hong Kong; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: enabling photographs or copies of the material to be taken or made and the onward transmission to Hong Kong of those photographs or copies; or

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: give access to the material for the purposes of enabling photographs or copies of the material to be taken or made and the onward transmission to Hong Kong of those photographs or copies.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Requests to Hong Kong for production, etc. of material

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a criminal matter involving an external serious offence has commenced in a place outside Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: there are reasonable grounds to believe that particular material or material of a particular description relevant to the criminal matter may be—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: located in Hong Kong; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: likely to become located in Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that place requests the Secretary for Justice to obtain an order under this section in relation to that material,

subsection.continued: then the Secretary for Justice may nominate in writing an authorized officer to make an application to the court for the order so requested. (Amended L.N. 362 of 1997)

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (10), the court may, if on an application referred to in subsection (1) made by an authorized officer nominated under subsection (1) it is satisfied that the conditions in subsection (5) are fulfilled, make an order—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: that the person who appears to the court to be in possession or control of the material to which the application relates shall—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: produce the material to an authorized officer—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: for him to take away and transmit to the place outside Hong Kong which made the request under subsection (1) which gave rise to the application; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: to enable him to take photographs or make copies of the material for the onward transmission to that place of those photographs or copies; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: give an authorized officer access to the material to enable him to take photographs or make copies of the material for the onward transmission to that place of those photographs or copies,

paragraph.continued: within such period as the order may specify;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: that the person who appears to the court likely to come into possession or control of the material to which the application relates shall, when the person comes into possession or control of any such material—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: produce the material to an authorized officer—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: for him to take away and transmit to the place outside Hong Kong which made the request under subsection (1) which gave rise to the application; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: to enable him to take photographs or make copies of the material for the onward transmission to that place of those photographs or copies; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: give an authorized officer access to the material to enable him to take photographs or make copies of the material for the onward transmission to that place of those photographs or copies,

paragraph.continued: within such period as the order may specify; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in terms both of paragraphs (a) and (b).

subsection.leadIn: An order under subsection (2), in so far as it is in terms of paragraph (b) of that subsection, shall cease to have effect upon the expiration of 3 months after the day on which the order is made, or upon the expiration of such lesser period, if any, as is specified in the order for the purpose, but nothing in this subsection shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: affect any obligation incurred under that order prior to its expiration;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: prevent, in relation to the person required to comply with that order, any further order being made under that subsection in respect of that person (including before the expiration of that first-mentioned order).

subsection.content: The period to be specified in an order under subsection (2) shall be 7 days unless it appears to the court that a longer or shorter period would be appropriate in the particular circumstances of the application.

subsection.leadIn: The conditions referred to in subsection (2) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: that there are reasonable grounds for believing that the material to which the application relates—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is likely to be of substantial value (whether by itself or together with other material) to the criminal matter for the purpose of which the application is made; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: does not consist of or include items subject to legal privilege; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: that there are reasonable grounds for believing that it is in the public interest, having regard—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to the benefit likely to accrue to the criminal matter, if the material is obtained; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: to the circumstances under which the person—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: in possession or control of the material holds or controls it, as the case may be; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: likely to come into possession or control of the material will hold or control it, as the case may be, if he comes into such possession or control,

paragraph.continued: that the material should be produced or that access to it should be given; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of an order proposed to be made under subsection (2)(a)(i)(A) or (b)(i)(A), the Secretary for Justice has advised that— (Amended L.N. 362 of 1997)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the appropriate authority of the place outside Hong Kong concerned has given him a notice in writing setting out the grounds on which the original of the material is required for the purposes of the criminal matter; and

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: because he is of the opinion, after considering all the circumstances, that the original of the material should be returned to Hong Kong upon the conclusion of the proceedings relating to the criminal matter, he has sought and received from the appropriate authority an unqualified undertaking that the original of the material will be so returned; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: he is not of that opinion.

subsection.content: Where a court makes an order under subsection (2)(a)(ii) or (b)(ii) in relation to material on any premises it may, on the same or a subsequent application of an authorized officer nominated under subsection (1), order any person who appears to him to be entitled to grant entry to the premises to allow an authorized officer to enter the premises to obtain access to the material.

subsection.leadIn: Rules of court may provide for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the discharge and variation of orders under this section; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: proceedings relating to such orders.

subsection.leadIn: Where the material to which an application under this section relates consists of information contained in or accessible by means of any data equipment—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an order under subsection (2)(a)(i) or (b)(i) shall have effect as an order to produce the material in a form in which it can be taken away and in which it is visible and legible; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an order under subsection (2)(a)(ii) or (b)(ii) shall have effect as an order to give access to the material in a form in which it is visible and legible.

subsection.leadIn: An order under subsection (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall not confer any right to production of, or access to, items subject to legal privilege;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: where—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the person to which the order relates is a tax adviser or relevant auditor; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the criminal matter to which the order relates is an investigation into an external offence relating to taxation,

paragraph.continued: shall not confer any right to production of, or access to, items which are tax documents and—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the property of the tax adviser or relevant auditor, as the case may be; and

subparagraph.name: B

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: subject to section 3(3), shall have effect notwithstanding any obligation as to secrecy or other restriction upon the disclosure of information imposed by statute or otherwise if the Secretary for Justice is satisfied that it is in the public interest of Hong Kong that it have such effect; and (Amended L.N. 362 of 1997)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: may be made in relation to material in the possession of a public body if the Secretary for Justice is satisfied that it is in the public interest of Hong Kong that it may be so made. (Amended L.N. 362 of 1997)

subsection.content: In the case of material in the possession of a public body, an order under subsection (2) may require any officer of the public body (whether named in the order or not) who may for the time being be in possession of the material concerned to comply with it, and such an order shall be served as if the proceedings were civil proceedings against the Government.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: DataEquipment
def.leadIn: data equipment (數據設備) means any equipment which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: automatically processes information;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: automatically records or stores information;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: can be used to cause information to be automatically recorded, stored or otherwise processed on other equipment (wherever situated);

paragraph.name: d

def.name: PublicBody
def.leadIn: public body (公共機構) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any Government department; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any body specified by the Chief Executive under subsection (12). (Amended 71 of 1999 s. 3)

subsection.content: The Chief Executive may, by notice in the Gazette, specify a body to be a public body for the purposes of this section. (Amended 71 of 1999 s. 3)

part.name: P5
part.heading: Transfer of Persons to Give Assistance in Relation to Criminal Matters

section.name: s16
section.heading: Requests for removal to Hong Kong

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a criminal matter has commenced in Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the Secretary for Justice is of the opinion that a person who is in a place outside Hong Kong—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is an external prisoner;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is capable of giving assistance in relation to the criminal matter; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: has consented to being removed to Hong Kong for the purpose of giving such assistance,

subsection.continued: then the Secretary for Justice may request that place to authorize the removal of that person to Hong Kong for that purpose.

subsection.leadIn: Where the Secretary for Justice makes a request under subsection (1), he may make arrangements with an appropriate authority of the place outside Hong Kong concerned for the purposes of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the removal of the person to Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the custody of the person while in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the return of the person to that place; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: other relevant matters.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (2)(b), the Secretary for Justice may direct in writing the Commissioner, within the meaning of the Prisons Ordinance (Cap. 234), or other appropriate person to keep in custody a person referred to in that subsection, and the Commissioner or that other appropriate person, as the case may be, shall comply with any such direction.

section.name: s17
section.heading: Immunities

subsection.leadIn: Where a person is in Hong Kong—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: pursuant to a request under section 16; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to give assistance in relation to a criminal matter, pursuant to a request made by the Secretary for Justice (not being a request under section 16) to a place outside Hong Kong for assistance in the criminal matter, (Amended L.N. 362 of 1997)

subsection.continued: then the person, subject to subsection (3), shall not—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: be detained, prosecuted or punished in Hong Kong for any Hong Kong offence that is alleged to have been committed, or that was committed, before the person’s departure from the place outside Hong Kong concerned pursuant to the request;

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: be subjected to any civil suit in respect of any act or omission of the person that is alleged to have occurred, or that occurred, before the person’s departure from the place outside Hong Kong concerned pursuant to the request, being a civil suit to which the person could not be subjected if the person were not in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: iii
paragraph.content: be required to give assistance in relation to any criminal matter in Hong Kong other than the criminal matter to which the request relates;

paragraph.name: iv
paragraph.content: be required, in relation to the criminal matter to which the request relates, to answer any question that the person would not be required to answer in relation to the criminal matter in the place outside Hong Kong concerned; or

paragraph.name: v
paragraph.content: be required, in relation to the criminal matter to which the request relates, to produce a thing that the person would not be required to produce in relation to the criminal matter in the place outside Hong Kong concerned.

subsection.content: A duly certified external law immunity certificate is admissible in proceedings as evidence of the matters stated in the certificate.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) ceases to apply to a person if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person has left Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the person has had an opportunity of leaving Hong Kong and has remained in Hong Kong otherwise than for—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the purpose to which the request relates; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the purpose of giving assistance in relation to a criminal matter in Hong Kong certified in writing by the Secretary for Justice to be a criminal matter in relation to which it is desirable that the person give assistance. (Amended L.N. 362 of 1997)

subsection.content: Subsection (1)(iv) or (v) does not apply in a case where its application would be inconsistent with any provision of prescribed arrangements, if any, between Hong Kong and the prescribed place concerned.

A certificate given by the Secretary for Justice for the purposes of subsection (3)(b)(ii) has effect from the day specified in the certificate (which may be a day before the day on which the certificate is given). (Amended L.N. 362 of 1997)

section.name: s18
section.heading: Status of person prosecuted for Hong Kong offence committed after departure from place outside Hong Kong

subsection.content: Where a person has come to Hong Kong pursuant to a request under section 16, the person shall be taken, for the purposes of this Ordinance, to be in Hong Kong pursuant to the request during any period during which the person remains in Hong Kong for the purpose of being tried for a Hong Kong offence that the person is alleged to have committed after the person’s departure from the place outside Hong Kong concerned.
Without limiting the generality of subsection (1), the person shall be kept in such custody as the Secretary for Justice directs under section 16(3). (Amended L.N. 362 of 1997)

section.name: s19
section.heading: Limitation on use of statement made by certain persons

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a person is in Hong Kong—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: pursuant to a request under section 16; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to give assistance in relation to a criminal matter pursuant to a request made by the Secretary for Justice (not being a request under section 16), to a place outside Hong Kong for assistance in the criminal matter; and (Amended L.N. 362 of 1997)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person has made a statement in relation to the criminal matter to which the request relates or in relation to a criminal matter certified by the Secretary for Justice under section 17(3)(b)(ii) in relation to the person, (Amended L.N. 362 of 1997)

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: shall not be admitted or otherwise used in any prosecution of the person for a Hong Kong offence other than an offence under section 36 of the Crimes Ordinance (Cap. 200);

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: may be admitted or used against him for the purpose of impeaching his credibility in criminal proceedings in respect of a Hong Kong offence where in giving evidence he makes a statement inconsistent with it.

section.name: s20
section.heading: Release of certain persons upon request by place outside Hong Kong

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person is being held in custody in accordance with a direction of the Secretary for Justice under section 16(3); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the place outside Hong Kong from which the person has been brought requests the release of the person from custody,

section.continued: then the Secretary for Justice shall direct that the person be released from custody.

section.name: s21
section.heading: Escaping
section.content: Any person who escapes from lawful custody while in Hong Kong pursuant to a request under section 16 commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

section.name: s22
section.heading: Arrest of person who has escaped from custody

subsection.leadIn: Any police officer may, without warrant, arrest a person, if the police officer has reasonable grounds to believe that the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has been brought to Hong Kong pursuant to a request under section 16; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has escaped from lawful custody while in Hong Kong pursuant to the request.

subsection.content: A person who has been arrested pursuant to subsection (1) shall be returned to custody in accordance with this Ordinance.

section.name: s23
section.heading: Requests for removal from Hong Kong

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a criminal matter has commenced in a place outside Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that place requests that a Hong Kong prisoner (whether or not in custody) or other person in Hong Kong travel to that place to give assistance in relation to the criminal matter;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: there are reasonable grounds to believe that the prisoner or other person is capable of giving such assistance; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: the Secretary for Justice is satisfied that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: that place has given adequate (whether or not unqualified) undertakings in respect of the matters referred to in subsection (2); and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the prisoner or other person has been given a copy of those undertakings and has subsequently consented to giving such assistance in that place,

subsection.continued: then the Secretary for Justice may—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a Hong Kong prisoner who is being held in custody—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: direct that the prisoner be released from custody for the purpose of travelling to that place to give such assistance; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: subject to the making or giving of any necessary directions or approvals in relation to the release of the prisoner, make arrangements for the travel of the prisoner to that place in the custody of a police or prison officer appointed by the Secretary for Justice for the purpose;

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a Hong Kong prisoner, having been released from custody on a parole or other order or licence to be at large, who is not being held in custody—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: approve the travel of the prisoner to that place to give such assistance and obtain such approvals, authorities, permissions or variations to the parole or other order or licence to be at large as may be required; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: subject to the obtaining of any necessary approvals, authorities, permissions or variations to the parole or other order or licence to be at large, make arrangements for the travel of the prisoner to that place;

paragraph.name: iii
paragraph.content: in the case of any other person, make arrangements for the travel of the person to that place.

subsection.leadIn: The matters in relation to which undertakings are to be given by a place outside Hong Kong for the purpose of a request that a person give assistance referred to in subsection (1) in the place are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: that the person shall not—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: be detained, prosecuted or punished for any external offence that is alleged to have been committed, or that was committed, before the person’s departure from Hong Kong;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: be subjected to any civil suit in respect of any act or omission of the person that is alleged to have occurred, or that occurred, before the person’s departure from Hong Kong, being a civil suit to which the person could not be subjected if the person were not in the place; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: be required to give assistance in relation to a criminal matter in the place other than the criminal matter to which the request relates,

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the person has left the place; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the person has had the opportunity of leaving the place and has remained in that place otherwise than for the purpose of giving assistance in relation to the criminal matter to which the request relates;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: that any statement made by the person in relation to the criminal matter to which the request relates will be inadmissible or otherwise disqualified from use in the prosecution of the person for an external offence other than—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: perjury; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: contempt of court;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that the person will be returned to Hong Kong in accordance with arrangements agreed by the Secretary for Justice;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: in a case where the person is being held in custody in Hong Kong and the Secretary for Justice requests the place to make arrangements for the keeping of the person in custody while the person is in that place—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the making of appropriate arrangements for that purpose;

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: will not be released from custody in the place unless the Secretary for Justice notifies an appropriate authority of the place that the person is entitled to be released from custody under the law of Hong Kong;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: where the Secretary for Justice so notifies the appropriate authority, will be released from custody in the place; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: if the person is released in the place as mentioned in subparagraph (ii), that the person’s accommodation and expenses pending the completion of the criminal matter to which the request relates will be paid for by the place; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: such other matters, if any, as the Secretary for Justice thinks appropriate.

section.name: s24
section.heading: Effect of removal to place outside Hong Kong on prisoner’s term of imprisonment
section.content: Where a Hong Kong prisoner who is serving a term of imprisonment for a Hong Kong offence is released from custody pursuant to a request under section 23, the prisoner shall, while in custody in connection with the request (including custody outside Hong Kong), be deemed to be continuing to serve that term of imprisonment.

part.name: P6
part.heading: Assistance in Relation to Confiscation, etc. of Proceeds of Crime

section.name: s25
section.heading: Requests by Hong Kong for enforcement of Hong Kong confiscation order
section.leadIn: The Secretary for Justice may request an appropriate authority of a place outside Hong Kong to make arrangements— (Amended L.N. 362 of 1997)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the enforcement of a Hong Kong confiscation order; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where a Hong Kong confiscation order may be made in a proceeding which has been or is to be instituted in Hong Kong, to restrain dealing in any property against which the order may be enforced or which may be available to satisfy the order.

section.name: s26
section.heading: Satisfaction of Hong Kong confiscation order

subsection.content: Where, in execution of a Hong Kong confiscation order pursuant to a request under section 25, property is recovered in a place outside Hong Kong but the order requires an amount specified therein to be payable, then that amount shall be treated as reduced by the value of property so recovered.

For the purposes of this section and without prejudice to the admissibility of any evidence which may be admissible apart from this subsection, a certificate purporting to be issued by or on behalf of an appropriate authority of a place outside Hong Kong stating that property has been recovered there in execution of a request under section 25, stating the value of the property so recovered and the date on which it was recovered shall, in any proceedings in a court in Hong Kong, be admissible as evidence of the facts so stated.

Where the value of property recovered as described in subsection (1) is expressed in a currency other than that of Hong Kong, the extent to which the amount payable under the Hong Kong confiscation order is to be reduced under that subsection shall be calculated on the basis of the exchange rate prevailing on the date on which the property was recovered in the place outside Hong Kong concerned.

For the purposes of subsection (3), a certificate purporting to be signed by the Monetary Authority and stating the exchange rate prevailing on a specified date shall be admissible in any proceedings as evidence of the facts so stated.

section.name: s27
section.heading: Requests to Hong Kong for enforcement of external confiscation order

subsection.leadIn: Where a place outside Hong Kong requests the Secretary for Justice to make arrangements—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the enforcement of an external confiscation order; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where an external confiscation order may be made in a proceeding which has been or is to be instituted in that place, to restrain dealing in any property against which the order may be enforced or which may be available to satisfy the order,

subsection.continued: then the Secretary for Justice may, in relation to that request, act for that place under the provisions of Schedule 2.

subsection.content: A request under subsection (1) shall, unless the contrary is shown, be deemed to constitute the authority of the place outside Hong Kong concerned for the Secretary for Justice to act on its behalf in any proceedings in the Court of First Instance under section 28 or under any provision of Schedule 2. (Amended 25 of 1998 s. 2)

section.name: s28
section.heading: Registration of external confiscation orders
