subsection.leadIn: On an application made by the Secretary for Justice, the Court of First Instance may register an external confiscation order if— (Amended L.N. 362 of 1997; 25 of 1998 s. 2)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is satisfied that at the time of registration the order is in force and not subject to appeal;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is satisfied, where any person against whom, or in relation to whose property, the order is made does not appear in the proceedings, that he received notice of the proceedings, in accordance with the law of the place outside Hong Kong concerned, in sufficient time to enable him to defend them; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: it is of the opinion that enforcing the order in Hong Kong would not be contrary to the interests of justice.

def.name: Appeal
def.leadIn: In subsection (1), appeal (上訴) includes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any proceedings by way of discharging or setting aside a judgment; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an application for a new trial or a stay of execution.

subsection.content: For the purposes of this section, an external confiscation order is subject to appeal so long as an appeal, further appeal or review is pending against the order; and for this purpose an appeal, further appeal or review shall be treated as pending (where one is competent but has not been instituted) until the expiration of the time prescribed for instituting the appeal, further appeal or review under the law of the place outside Hong Kong concerned.

subsection.leadIn: The Court of First Instance shall cancel the registration of an external confiscation order if it appears to the Court of First Instance that the order has been satisfied by— (Amended 25 of 1998 s. 2)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: payment of the amount due under it or by the person against whom it was made serving imprisonment in default of such payment;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: recovery of property specified in it (or the value of such property) or by the person against whom it was made serving imprisonment in default of such recovery; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other means.

subsection.content: Where an amount of money, if any, payable or remaining to be paid under an external confiscation order registered in the Court of First Instance under this section is expressed in a currency other than that of Hong Kong, for the purpose of any action taken in relation to that order under Schedule 2 the amount shall be converted into the currency of Hong Kong on the basis of the exchange rate prevailing on the date of registration of the order. (Amended 25 of 1998 s. 2)

For the purposes of subsection (5), a certificate purporting to be signed by or on behalf of the Monetary Authority and stating the exchange rate prevailing on a specified date shall be admissible in any proceedings as evidence of the facts so stated.

section.name: s29
section.heading: Proof of orders and judgments of court in place outside Hong Kong

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of sections 27 and 28 and Schedule 2—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any order made or judgment given by a court in a place outside Hong Kong purporting to bear the seal of that court or to be signed by any person in his capacity as a judge, magistrate or officer of the court, shall be deemed without further proof to have been duly sealed or, as the case may be, to have been signed by that person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a document, duly certified, which purports to be a copy of any order made or judgment given by a court in a place outside Hong Kong shall be deemed without further proof to be a true copy.

subsection.content: A document purporting to be a copy of any order made or judgment given by a court in a place outside Hong Kong is duly certified for the purpose of subsection (1)(b) if it purports to be certified by any person in his capacity as a judge, magistrate or officer of the court in question or by or on behalf of the appropriate authority of the place outside Hong Kong concerned.

section.name: s30
section.heading: Evidence in relation to proceedings and orders in place outside Hong Kong

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of sections 27 and 28 and Schedule 2, a certificate purporting to be issued by or on behalf of the appropriate authority of a place outside Hong Kong stating—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that a proceeding has been instituted and has not been concluded, or that a proceeding is to be instituted, in the place;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that an external confiscation order is in force and is not subject to appeal;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that all or a certain amount of the sum payable under an external confiscation order remains unpaid in the place, or that other property recoverable under an external confiscation order remains unrecovered in the place;

paragraph.name: d
e
paragraph.leadIn: that an order (however described) made by a court in the place has the purpose of—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: payments or other rewards received in connection with an external serious offence or their value;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: property derived or realised, directly or indirectly, from payments or other rewards received in connection with an external serious offence or the value of such property; or

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: property used or intended to be used in connection with an external serious offence or the value of such property; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: depriving a person of a pecuniary advantage obtained in connection with an external serious offence,

subsection.continued: shall, in any proceeding in the Court of First Instance, be admissible as evidence of the facts so stated. (Amended 25 of 1998 s. 2)

subsection.content: In any such proceeding a statement contained in a document, duly certified, which purports to have been received in evidence or to be a copy of a document so received, or to set out or summarise evidence given in proceedings in a court in a place outside Hong Kong, shall be admissible as evidence of any fact stated therein.

A document is duly certified for the purposes of subsection (2) if it purports to be certified by any person in his capacity as a judge, magistrate or officer of the court in the place outside Hong Kong concerned, or by or on behalf of an appropriate authority of the place, to have been received in evidence or to be a copy of a document so received or, as the case may be, to be the original document containing or summarising the evidence or a true copy of that document.
Nothing in this section shall prejudice the admission of any evidence, whether contained in any document or otherwise, which is admissible apart from this section.

section.name: s31
section.heading: Service of documents

subsection.content: Where a place outside Hong Kong requests the Secretary for Justice to arrange for the service in Hong Kong of a process relating to a criminal matter in that place, then the Secretary for Justice may arrange for the service of the process. (Amended L.N. 362 of 1997)

Without limiting the manner in which the service of a document in a place outside Hong Kong may be proved in Hong Kong, service of such a document may be proved by affidavit of the person who served the document.
Any failure to comply with any process referred to in this section is not an offence under the law of Hong Kong.

section.name: s32
section.heading: Certification of documents

subsection.content: In a criminal matter to which this Ordinance relates, any document that is duly certified is admissible in evidence.

A document is duly certified for the purposes of subsection (1) if it purports to be authenticated by the oath of a witness or an officer of the government of the place outside Hong Kong concerned or to be sealed with an official or public seal of the place or of a minister of state, or of a department or officer of the government, of the place.
Nothing in this section prevents the proof of any matter, or the admission in evidence of any document, in accordance with any other provision of this Ordinance or law of Hong Kong.

section.name: s33
section.heading: Regulations
section.leadIn: The Chief Executive in Council may make regulations— (Amended 71 of 1999 s. 3)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: prescribing anything that is required or permitted to be prescribed under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: generally for the better and more effectual carrying out of the provisions of this Ordinance, including incidental, consequential, evidential and supplemental provisions,

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: prescribing the practice and procedure in relation to the performance by magistrates of functions under this Ordinance, including the summoning of witnesses, the production of documents, the taking of evidence on oath or otherwise than on oath, the administering of oaths, the payment of expenses and allowances of witnesses and the protection and immunity of magistrates, of barristers and solicitors appearing before magistrates and of witnesses; and (Amended 23 of 2003 s. 21)

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: prescribing penalties not exceeding a fine at level 3 or imprisonment for 6 months for offences against the regulations.

section.name: s34
section.heading: Chief Executive to give notice to Central People’s Government in relation to Hong Kong requests and external requests

subsection.content: The Chief Executive shall cause the Central People’s Government to be given notice of every Hong Kong request and external request.

subsection.leadIn: Where the Central People’s Government issues an instruction to the Chief Executive to take, or not to take, an action—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a Hong Kong request or external request; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on the ground that if the instruction were not complied with the interests of the People’s Republic of China in matters of sovereignty, security or public order would be significantly affected,

subsection.continued: then the Chief Executive and the Secretary for Justice shall comply with that instruction, but no such instruction shall operate to affect the responsibility that the Chief Executive or the Secretary for Justice shall discharge in accordance with law in dealing with any case to which this subsection applies. (Amended L.N. 362 of 1997)

subsection.leadIn: A notice under subsection (1) shall—

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.leadIn: be accompanied by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a copy of the request;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: copies of the accompanying documents;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a summary of the material facts supporting the request; and

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: such other documents relevant to the request as may be required by the Central People’s Government;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of an external request—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: state advice with reasons whether the request may be complied with; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: give details of the assistance which will be, or in the case of an urgent request has been, provided.

subsection.content: Where an external request has been complied with, the Chief Executive shall, if the Central People’s Government so requires, provide the Central People’s Government with particulars of any evidence or documents provided pursuant to the request.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a Hong Kong request is urgent if it is a request under section 11 or 25;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an external request is urgent if it is a request under section 12 or 27.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: ExternalRequest
def.leadIn: external request (外地請求) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any request under any arrangements for mutual legal assistance, whether or not the arrangements are prescribed arrangements; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: any other request—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the government of a place outside Hong Kong; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: a place outside Hong Kong;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: for assistance in a criminal matter; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: compliance with which requires the exercise of any power under an enactment of Hong Kong;

def.name: HongKongRequest
def.leadIn: Hong Kong request (香港請求) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any request under any arrangements for mutual legal assistance, whether or not the arrangements are prescribed arrangements; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: any other request—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: by the Government or Hong Kong;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: for assistance in a criminal matter; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: compliance with which requires the exercise of any power under an enactment of a place outside Hong Kong.

section.name: s35
section.heading: Amendment of Schedules

subsection.content: The Legislative Council may, by resolution, amend Schedule 1.
The Chief Executive in Council may, by notice in the Gazette, amend Schedule 2. (Amended 71 of 1999 s. 3)

section.name: s36
section.heading: Consequential and other amendments
section.content: The enactments specified in Schedule 3 are amended as set out in that Schedule.

section.name: s0
section.leadIn: Any document which is a communication between a tax adviser and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person (client) in relation to whose tax affairs he has been appointed as a tax adviser; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other tax adviser of the client,

section.continued: the purpose of which is the giving or obtaining of advice about any of those tax affairs, but excluding any information giving the identity or address of the client or of any tax adviser.

section.name: s0
section.content: Any document relating to tax which was created by or on behalf of a relevant auditor for or in connection with the performance of his functions under any enactment.

schedule.name: sch2
schedule.heading: Enforcement, etc. of External Confiscation Orders

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: In this Schedule, unless the context otherwise requires—
subsection.def: interest (權益), in relation to property, includes right;
Registrar (司法常務官) means the Registrar of the High Court; (Amended 25 of 1998 s. 2)

def.name: RelevantAsset
def.leadIn: relevant asset (有關資產) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any land, within the meaning of section 2 of the High Court Ordinance (Cap. 4), in Hong Kong; (Amended 25 of 1998 s. 2)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any Government stock within the meaning of section 2 of that Ordinance;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any stock, within the meaning of section 20A of that Ordinance, of any body incorporated in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any stock, within the meaning of section 20A of that Ordinance, of any body incorporated outside Hong Kong or of any place outside Hong Kong, being stock registered in a register kept at any place within Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: any units of any unit trust, within the meaning of section 20A of that Ordinance, in respect of which a register of the unit holders is kept at any place within Hong Kong.

subsection.content:
The expressions listed in the left hand column below are respectively defined or (as the case may be) fall to be construed in accordance with the provisions of this Schedule listed in the right hand column in relation to those expressions.
Expression
Relevant provision
Charging order (押記令)
Section 8(2)
Defendant (被告人)
Section 3
Gift caught by this Schedule (受本附表囿制的饋贈)
Section 5(6)
Making a gift (作出饋贈)
Section 5(7)
Realisable property (可變現財產)
Section 5(1)
Restraint order (限制令)
Section 7(1)
Value of gift, payment or reward (饋贈、付款或酬賞的價值)
Section 5(4)
Value of property (財產的價值)
Section 5(3)
This Schedule applies to property whether it is situated in Hong Kong or elsewhere.

References in this Schedule to property received in connection with an external serious offence include a reference to property received both in that connection and in some other connection, and whether received before or after the commencement* of this Schedule and whether received in connection with an external serious offence committed by the recipient or some other person.
Subsections (6) to (11) shall have effect for the interpretation of this Schedule.
Property is held by any person if he holds any interest in it.
References to property held by a person include a reference to property vested in his trustee in bankruptcy or in a liquidator.

References to an interest held by a person beneficially in property include, where the property is vested in his trustee in bankruptcy or in a liquidator, a reference to an interest which would be held by him beneficially if the property were not so vested.
Property is transferred by one person to another if the first person transfers or grants to the other any interest in the property.

subsection.leadIn: Proceedings are concluded in a place outside Hong Kong—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: on the satisfaction of an external confiscation order made in the proceedings (whether by the recovery of all property liable to be recovered, or the payment of any amount due, or otherwise).

subsection.content: An order is subject to appeal until (disregarding any power of a court to grant leave to appeal out of time) there is no further possibility of an appeal on which the order could be varied or set aside.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Application
section.leadIn: This Schedule shall not apply to an external confiscation order except an external confiscation order—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the subject of a request under section 27 of this Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to which the Secretary for Justice has decided to act, for the place which made the request, under the provisions of this Schedule. (Amended L.N. 362 of 1997)

section.name: s3
section.heading: Defendants under external confiscation orders
section.def: A person (however described in the proceedings in the place outside Hong Kong concerned) against whom, or in relation to whose property, an external confiscation order has been, or may be, made is referred to in this Schedule as the defendant (被告人).

section.name: s4
section.heading: Interest on amounts to be recovered under external confiscation orders

subsection.content: Where a fixed amount is payable under an external confiscation order, that amount shall be treated as a judgment debt for the purposes of section 49 of the High Court Ordinance (Cap. 4) and, for those purposes, the date on which the external confiscation order was registered under section 28 of this Ordinance shall be treated as the date of the judgment debt. (Amended 25 of 1998 s. 2)

Where by virtue of subsection (1) any interest accrues on the amount payable under an external confiscation order, the defendant shall be liable to pay that interest and the amount of the interest shall for the purposes of enforcement be treated as part of the amount payable under the external confiscation order.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Definition of principal terms used

def.name: RealisableProperty
def.leadIn: In this Schedule, realisable property (可變現財產) means, subject to subsection (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to an external confiscation order—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: made in respect of specified property, the property which is specified in the order;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: which may be made as the result of proceedings which have been, or are to be, instituted in a place outside Hong Kong, the property which may be specified in the order; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in any other case—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any property held by the defendant;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any property held by a person to whom the defendant has directly or indirectly made a gift caught by this Schedule; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: any property that is subject to the effective control of the defendant.

subsection.leadIn: Property is not realisable property if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an order under section 102 or 103 of the Criminal Procedure Ordinance (Cap. 221); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an order under section 38F or 56 of the Dangerous Drugs Ordinance (Cap. 134),

subsection.continued: is in force in respect of the property.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to the following subsections, for the purposes of this Schedule the value of property (other than cash) in relation to any person holding the property—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: where any other person holds an interest in the property, is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the market value of the first-mentioned person’s beneficial interest in the property, less

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the amount required to discharge any incumbrance (other than a charging order) on that interest; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other case, is its market value.

def.name: TheMaterialTime
def.leadIn: Subject to subsection (7), references in this Schedule to the value at any time (referred to in subsection (5) as the material time (關鍵時間)) of a gift caught by this Schedule or of any payment or reward are references to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the value of the gift, payment or reward to the recipient when he received it adjusted to take account of subsequent changes in the value of money; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where subsection (5) applies, the value there mentioned,

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (7), if at the material time the recipient holds—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the property which he received (not being cash); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: property which, in whole or in part, directly or indirectly represents in his hands the property which he received,

subsection.continued: the value referred to in subsection (4)(b) is the value to him at the material time of the property mentioned in paragraph (a) or, as the case may be, of the property mentioned in paragraph (b) so far as it so represents the property which he received, but disregarding in either case any charging order.

subsection.leadIn: A gift (including a gift made before the commencement* of this Schedule) is caught by this Schedule if—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn: it was made by the defendant at any time and was a gift of property—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: received by the defendant in connection with an external serious offence committed by him or another; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: which in whole or in part directly or indirectly represented in the defendant’s hands property received by him in that connection.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Schedule—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the circumstances in which the defendant is to be treated as making a gift include those where he transfers property to another person directly or indirectly for a consideration the value of which is significantly less than the value of the consideration provided by the defendant; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in those circumstances, the preceding provisions of this section shall apply as if the defendant had made a gift of such share in the property as bears to the whole property the same proportion as the difference between the values referred to in paragraph (a) bears to the value of the consideration provided by the defendant.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: property, or an interest in property, may be subject to the effective control of the defendant whether or not the defendant has—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a legal or equitable estate or interest in the property; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a right, power or privilege in connection with the property;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: without limiting the generality of any other provision of this Schedule, in determining—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: whether or not property, or an interest in property, is subject to the effective control of the defendant; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: whether or not there are reasonable grounds to believe that property, or an interest in property, is subject to the effective control of the defendant,

subparagraph.name: A
B
subparagraph.content: a trust that has a relationship to the property; and

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: family, domestic and business relationships between persons having an interest in the property, or in companies of the kind referred to in subparagraph (A) or trusts of the kind referred to in subparagraph (B), and other persons.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Cases in which restraint orders and charging orders may be made

subsection.leadIn: The powers conferred on the Court of First Instance by sections 7(1) and 8(1) are exercisable where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: proceedings have been instituted in a place outside Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the proceedings have not been concluded; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: either an external confiscation order has been made in the proceedings or it appears to the Court of First Instance that there are reasonable grounds for believing that an external confiscation order may be made in them.

subsection.content: Those powers are also exercisable where the Court of First Instance is satisfied that proceedings are to be instituted in a place outside Hong Kong and it appears to the court that an external confiscation order may be made in them.

Where the Court of First Instance has made an order under section 7(1) or 8(2) by virtue of subsection (2), it shall discharge the order if the proposed proceedings are not instituted within such time as the Court of First Instance considers reasonable.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Restraint orders

subsection.def: The Court of First Instance may by order (in this Schedule referred to as a restraint order (限制令)) prohibit any person from dealing with any realisable property, subject to such conditions and exceptions as may be specified in the order.

subsection.content: A restraint order may apply to any realisable property, including property transferred to a person after the making of the order.
This section shall not have effect in relation to any property for the time being subject to a charge under section 8.

subsection.leadIn: A restraint order—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may be made only on an application by the Secretary for Justice or, in a case where an external confiscation order has been registered under section 28 of this Ordinance, by a receiver appointed under section 9 or the Secretary for Justice; (Amended L.N. 362 of 1997)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may be made on an ex parte application to a judge in chambers; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: may, notwithstanding anything in Order 11 of the Rules of the High Court (Cap. 4 sub. leg. A), provide for service on, or the provision of notice to, persons affected by the order in such manner as the Court of First Instance may direct. (Amended E.R. 1 of 2013)

subsection.leadIn: A restraint order—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may be discharged or varied in relation to any property; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall be discharged when the proceedings in relation to which the order was made are concluded.

subsection.content: An application for the discharge or variation of a restraint order may be made by any person affected by it.

subsection.leadIn: Where the Court of First Instance has made a restraint order, the Court of First Instance may at any time appoint a receiver—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to take possession of any realisable property; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in accordance with the directions of the Court of First Instance, to manage or otherwise deal with any property in respect of which he is appointed,

subsection.continued: subject to such conditions and exceptions as may be specified by the Court of First Instance; and may require any person having possession of property in respect of which a receiver is appointed under this section to give possession of it to the receiver.

subsection.content: Where the Court of First Instance has made a restraint order, an authorized officer may, for the purpose of preventing any realisable property being removed from Hong Kong, seize the property.
Property seized under subsection (8) shall be dealt with in accordance with the directions of the Court of First Instance. (Amended 71 of 1999 s. 3)

subsection.leadIn: Where any property specified in a restraint order is immovable property the order shall, for the purposes of the Land Registration Ordinance (Cap. 128)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be deemed to be an instrument affecting land; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be registrable as such in the Land Registry under that Ordinance in such manner as the Land Registrar thinks fit.

subsection.content: An authorized officer may, by notice in writing served on a person who holds any realisable property the subject of a restraint order, require the person to deliver to the authorized officer, to the extent that it is practicable to do so, documents, or copies of documents, or any other information (in whatever form), in his possession or control which may assist the authorized officer to determine the value of the property. (Added 26 of 2002 s. 5)

A person who receives a notice under subsection (11) shall, as soon as is practicable after receipt of the notice, comply with the notice to the extent that it is practicable to do so taking into account the nature of the realisable property the subject of the restraint order concerned. (Added 26 of 2002 s. 5)

subsection.leadIn: A disclosure made in order to comply with a requirement under subsection (11)—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn: shall not render the person who made it liable in damages for any loss arising out of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the disclosure;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any act done or omitted to be done in relation to the property concerned in consequence of the disclosure. (Added 26 of 2002 s. 5)

subsection.content: Any person who contravenes subsection (12) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 1 year. (Added 26 of 2002 s. 5)
A person who knowingly deals in any realisable property in contravention of a restraint order commits an offence. (Added 26 of 2002 s. 5)

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (15) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction upon indictment to a fine of $500,000 or to the value of the realisable property the subject of the restraint order concerned which has been dealt with in contravention of that order, whichever is the greater, and to imprisonment for 5 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine of $250,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years. (Added 26 of 2002 s. 5)

section.name: s8
section.heading: Charging orders in respect of land, securities, etc.

subsection.leadIn: The Court of First Instance may make a charging order on realisable property for securing the payment to the Government—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where a fixed amount is payable under an external confiscation order, of an amount not exceeding the amount so payable; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other case, of an amount equal to the value from time to time of the property charged.

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Schedule, a charging order is an order made under this section imposing on any such realisable property as may be specified in the order a charge for securing the payment of money to the Government.

subsection.leadIn: A charging order—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may be made only on an application by the Secretary for Justice or, in a case where an external confiscation order has been registered under section 28 of this Ordinance, by a receiver appointed under section 9 or the Secretary for Justice; (Amended L.N. 362 of 1997)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may be made on an ex parte application to a judge in chambers;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: may, notwithstanding anything in Order 11 of the Rules of the High Court (Cap. 4 sub. leg. A), provide for service on, or the provision of notice to, persons affected by the order in such manner as the Court of First Instance may direct; and (Amended E.R. 1 of 2013)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: may be made subject to such conditions as the Court of First Instance thinks fit and, without prejudice to the generality of this paragraph, such conditions as it thinks fit as to the time when the charge is to become effective.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (6), a charge may be imposed by a charging order only on—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: any interest in realisable property, being an interest held beneficially by the defendant or by a person to whom the defendant has directly or indirectly made a gift caught by this Schedule—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in any relevant asset; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: under any trust; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any interest in realisable property held by a person as trustee of a trust if the interest is in such an asset or is an interest under another trust and a charge may by virtue of paragraph (a) be imposed by a charging order on the whole beneficial interest under the first-mentioned trust.

subsection.content: In any case where a charge is imposed by a charging order on any interest in a relevant asset, the Court of First Instance may provide for the charge to extend to any interest, dividend or other distribution payable and any bonus issue in respect of the asset.

The Court of First Instance may make an order discharging or varying the charging order and shall make an order discharging the charging order if the proceedings in the place outside Hong Kong are concluded or the amount payment of which is secured by the charge is paid into the Court of First Instance.
An application for the discharge or variation of a charging order may be made by any person affected by it.

Subject to the provisions of this Schedule, a charge imposed by a charging order shall have the like effect and shall be enforceable in the same manner as an equitable charge created by the person holding the beneficial interest or, as the case may be, the trustee, by writing under his hand.

An authorized officer may, by notice in writing served on a person who holds any realisable property the subject of a charging order, require the person to deliver to the authorized officer, to the extent that it is practicable to do so, documents, or copies of documents, or any other information (in whatever form), in his possession or control which may assist the authorized officer to determine the value of the property. (Added 26 of 2002 s. 5)

A person who receives a notice under subsection (9) shall, as soon as is practicable after receipt of the notice, comply with the notice to the extent that it is practicable to do so taking into account the nature of the realisable property the subject of the charging order concerned. (Added 26 of 2002 s. 5)

subsection.leadIn: A disclosure made in order to comply with a requirement under subsection (9)—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn: shall not render the person who made it liable in damages for any loss arising out of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the disclosure;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any act done or omitted to be done in relation to the property concerned in consequence of the disclosure. (Added 26 of 2002 s. 5)

subsection.content: Any person who contravenes subsection (10) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 1 year. (Added 26 of 2002 s. 5)
A person who knowingly deals in any realisable property in contravention of a charging order commits an offence. (Added 26 of 2002 s. 5)

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (13) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction upon indictment to a fine of $500,000 or to the value of the realisable property the subject of the charging order concerned which has been dealt with in contravention of that order, whichever is the greater, and to imprisonment for 5 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine of $250,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years. (Added 26 of 2002 s. 5)

section.name: s9
section.heading: Realisation of property

subsection.content: Where an external confiscation order has been registered under section 28 of this Ordinance, the Court of First Instance may, on an application by the Secretary for Justice, exercise the powers conferred by subsections (2) to (6). (Amended L.N. 362 of 1997)
The Court of First Instance may appoint a receiver in respect of realisable property.

subsection.leadIn: The Court of First Instance may empower a receiver appointed under subsection (2), under section 7 or in pursuance of a charging order—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to enforce any charge imposed under section 8 on realisable property or on any interest, dividend or other distribution payable and any bonus issue in respect of such property; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to any realisable property other than property for the time being subject to a charge under section 8, to take possession of the property subject to such conditions or exceptions as may be specified by the Court of First Instance.

subsection.content: The Court of First Instance may order any person having possession of realisable property to give possession of it to any such receiver.
The Court of First Instance may empower any such receiver to realise any realisable property in such manner as the Court of First Instance may direct.

The Court of First Instance may order any person holding an interest in realisable property to make such payment to the receiver in respect of any beneficial interest held by the defendant or, as the case may be, the recipient of a gift caught by this Schedule as the Court of First Instance may direct and the Court of First Instance may, on the payment being made, by order transfer, grant or extinguish any interest in the property.
Subsections (4) to (6) do not apply to property for the time being subject to a charge under section 8.

The Court of First Instance shall not in respect of any property exercise the powers conferred by subsection (3)(a), (5) or (6) unless a reasonable opportunity has been given for persons holding any interest in the property to make representations to the Court of First Instance.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Application of proceeds of realisation and other sums

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), the following sums in the hands of a receiver appointed under section 7 or 9 or pursuant to a charging order, that is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the proceeds of the enforcement of any charge imposed under section 8;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: any other sums, being property held by the defendant,

subsection.continued: shall first be applied in payment of such expenses incurred by a person acting as an insolvency officer as are payable under section 14(2) and then shall, after such payments, if any, as the Court of First Instance may direct have been made out of those sums be paid to the Registrar and applied for the purposes specified in subsections (3) to (5) and in the order so specified. (Amended 25 of 1998 s. 2)

subsection.leadIn: Where a fixed amount is payable under the external confiscation order and, after that amount has been fully paid, any such sums remain in the hands of such a receiver, the receiver shall distribute those sums—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: among such of those who held property which has been realised under this Schedule; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in such proportions,

subsection.continued: as the Court of First Instance may direct after giving a reasonable opportunity for such persons to make representations to the Court of First Instance. (Amended 25 of 1998 s. 2)

subsection.content: Any sums paid to the Registrar under subsection (1) or otherwise in satisfaction of an external confiscation order shall be first applied to pay any expenses incurred by a person acting as an insolvency officer and payable under section 14(2) but not already paid under subsection (1).
If the sum was paid to the Registrar by a receiver appointed under section 7 or 9 or pursuant to a charging order the Registrar shall next pay the receiver’s remuneration and expenses.

subsection.leadIn: After making—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any payment required by subsection (3); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in a case to which subsection (4) applies, any payment required by that subsection,

subsection.continued: the Registrar shall reimburse any amount paid under section 15(2).

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (7) and (8)—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: upon the expiration of 5 years beginning with the day on which such balance was so deposited, the Registrar shall arrange for such balance, together with any interest earned thereon, to be paid into the general revenue.

subsection.leadIn: On an application made by or on behalf of the government of a prescribed place before the expiration of the period referred to in subsection (6)(b) in respect of any balance referred to in that subsection, the Secretary for Justice may direct the Registrar to pay to that government such proportion of that balance as is specified in the direction and the Registrar shall, as soon as is reasonably practicable after the receipt of that direction— (Amended L.N. 362 of 1997)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: comply with the direction; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: pay any remainder of that balance, together with any interest earned on that balance, into the general revenue.

subsection.content: The Registrar shall not comply with subsection (6)(b) in respect of any balance referred to in that subsection (including any interest earned thereon) until any application referred to in subsection (7) made in respect of that balance has been determined, whether by a direction under subsection (7) or otherwise.

Where an application under subsection (8) of the relevant section has not been determined before the relevant day, then this section shall, with all necessary modifications, apply to and in relation to the application as if the application were an application under subsection (7), and the other provisions of this Ordinance shall be construed accordingly.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: relevant section (有關條文) means section 13 of the Drug Trafficking (Recovery of Proceeds) Ordinance (Cap. 405) as applied under paragraph 3(2) of the relevant Order.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Exercise of powers by Court of First Instance or receiver

subsection.content: The following subsections apply to the powers conferred on the Court of First Instance by sections 7 to 10, or on a receiver appointed under section 7 or 9 or pursuant to a charging order. (Amended 25 of 1998 s. 2)

Subject to subsections (3), (4), (5) and (6), the powers shall be exercised with a view to recovering property which is liable to be recovered under an external confiscation order registered under section 28 of this Ordinance or, as the case may be, with a view to making available for recovery property which may become liable to be recovered under an external confiscation order which may be made.

In the case of realisable property held by a person to whom the defendant has directly or indirectly made a gift caught by this Schedule, the powers shall be exercised with a view to realising no more than the value for the time being of the gift.

In the case of realisable property other than realisable property referred to in section 5(1)(a), the powers shall be exercised with a view to allowing any person other than the defendant or the recipient of any such gift to retain or recover the value of any property held by him.
An order may be made or other action taken in respect of a debt owed by the Government.

In exercising those powers, no account shall be taken of any obligations of the defendant or of the recipient of any such gift which conflict with the obligation to satisfy the external confiscation order.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Bankruptcy of defendant, etc.

subsection.leadIn: Where a person who holds realisable property is adjudged bankrupt—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: property for the time being subject to a restraint order made before the order adjudging him bankrupt; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any proceeds of property realised by virtue of section 7(7) or 9(5) or (6) for the time being in the hands of a receiver appointed under section 7 or 9,

subsection.continued: are excluded from the property of the bankrupt for the purposes of the Bankruptcy Ordinance (Cap. 6).

subsection.leadIn: Where a person has been adjudged bankrupt, the powers conferred on the Court of First Instance by sections 7 to 10 shall not be exercised in relation to— (Amended 25 of 1998 s. 2)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: property for the time being comprised in the property of the bankrupt for the purposes of the Bankruptcy Ordinance (Cap. 6); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: property which is to be applied for the benefit of creditors of the bankrupt by virtue of a condition imposed under section 30(3) of the Bankruptcy Ordinance (Cap. 6).

subsection.content: Nothing in the Bankruptcy Ordinance (Cap. 6) shall be taken as restricting, or enabling the restriction of, the exercise of the powers conferred on the Court of First Instance by sections 7 to 10. (Amended 25 of 1998 s. 2)

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (2) does not affect the enforcement of a charging order—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: made before the order adjudging the person bankrupt; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on property which was subject to a restraint order when the order adjudging him bankrupt was made.

subsection.content: Where, in the case of a debtor, an interim trustee stands appointed under section 13 of the Bankruptcy Ordinance (Cap. 6) and any property of the debtor is subject to a restraint order, the powers conferred on the interim trustee by virtue of that Ordinance do not apply to property for the time being subject to the restraint order. (Amended 18 of 2005 s. 48)

subsection.leadIn: Where a person is adjudged bankrupt and had directly or indirectly made a gift caught by this Schedule—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a court shall not make an order under—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: section 31, 47 or 49 of the Bankruptcy Ordinance (Cap. 6); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: section 60 of the Conveyancing and Property Ordinance (Cap. 219),

paragraph.continued: in respect of the making of the gift at any time when property of the person to whom the gift was made is subject to a restraint order or charging order; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any order made under any of those sections after the discharge of the restraint order or charging order shall take into account any realisation under this Schedule of property held by the person to whom the gift was made.

subsection.leadIn: After the relevant day—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subsection (2)(b) shall be read as if “30(3)” were omitted and “30A(9)” were substituted therefor;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subsection (6)(a)(i) shall be read as if “31, 47 or 49” were omitted and “49 or 50” were substituted therefor.

subsection.def: In this section, *relevant day (有關日期) means the day on which section 87 of the Bankruptcy (Amendment) Ordinance 1996 (76 of 1996) comes into operation.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Winding up of company holding realisable property

subsection.leadIn: Where realisable property is held by a company and an order for the winding up of the company has been made or a resolution has been passed by the company for the voluntary winding up, the functions of the liquidator (or any provisional liquidator) shall not be exercisable in relation to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: property for the time being subject to a restraint order made before the relevant time; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any proceeds of property realised by virtue of section 7(7) or 9(5) or (6) for the time being in the hands of a receiver appointed under section 7 or 9.

subsection.leadIn: Where, in the case of a company, such an order has been made or such a resolution has been passed, the powers conferred on the Court of First Instance by sections 7 to 10 shall not be exercised in relation to any realisable property held by the company in relation to which the functions of the liquidator are exercisable—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: so as to prevent the payment out of any property of expenses (including the remuneration of the liquidator or any provisional liquidator) properly incurred in the winding up in respect of the property.

subsection.content: Nothing in the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622) or the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32) shall be taken as restricting, or enabling the restriction of, the exercise of the powers conferred on the Court of First Instance by sections 7 to 10. (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

Subsection (3) shall apply to any proceedings relating to an appeal, further appeal or review against any exercise of the powers referred to in that subsection as if the court hearing the appeal, further appeal or review, as the case may be, were the Court of First Instance.
Subsection (2) does not affect the enforcement of a charging order made before the relevant time or on property which was subject to a restraint order at the relevant time.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: company (公司) means any company which may be wound up under the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32); (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

def.name: TheRelevantTime
def.leadIn: the relevant time (有關時間) means—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: where such an order has been made and, before the presentation of the petition for the winding up of the company by the Court of First Instance, such a resolution had been passed by the company, the time of the passing of the resolution; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in any other case where such an order has been made, the time of the making of the order.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Insolvency officers dealing with property subject to restraint order

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to the generality of any provision contained in the Bankruptcy Ordinance (Cap. 6), the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32) or any other Ordinance, where— (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any insolvency officer seizes or disposes of any property in relation to which his functions are not exercisable because it is for the time being subject to a restraint order; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: at the time of the seizure or disposal he believes, and has reasonable grounds for believing, that he is entitled (whether in pursuance of an order of a court or otherwise) to seize or dispose of that property,

subsection.continued: he shall not be liable to any person in respect of any loss or damage resulting from the seizure or disposal except in so far as the loss or damage is caused by his negligence; and the insolvency officer shall have a lien on the property, or the proceeds of its sale, for such of his expenses as were incurred in connection with the liquidation, bankruptcy or other proceedings in relation to which the seizure or disposal purported to take place and for so much of his remuneration as may reasonably be assigned for his acting in connection with those proceedings.

subsection.leadIn: Any insolvency officer who incurs expenses—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in respect of such property as is mentioned in subsection (1)(a) and in so doing does not know and has no reasonable grounds to believe that the property is for the time being subject to a restraint order; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: other than in respect of such property as is so mentioned, being expenses which, but for the effect of a restraint order, might have been met by taking possession of and realising the property,

subsection.continued: shall be entitled (whether or not he has seized or disposed of that property so as to have a lien under that subsection) to payment of those expenses under section 10(1).

def.name: InsolvencyOfficer
def.leadIn: In this section insolvency officer (債務處理人) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Official Receiver; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: any person acting as—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a trustee (including provisional trustee), interim trustee or special manager appointed under the Bankruptcy Ordinance (Cap. 6); or (Amended 18 of 2005 s. 48)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a liquidator, provisional liquidator or special manager appointed under the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32). (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

section.name: s15
section.heading: Receivers: supplementary provisions

subsection.leadIn: Where a receiver appointed under section 7 or 9 or pursuant to a charging order takes any action—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to property which is not realisable property, being action which he would be entitled to take if it were such property;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: believing, and having reasonable grounds for believing, that he is entitled to take that action in relation to that property,

subsection.continued: he shall not be liable to any person in respect of any loss or damage resulting from his action except in so far as the loss or damage is caused by his negligence.

subsection.content: Any amount due in respect of the remuneration and expenses of a receiver so appointed shall, if no sum is available to be applied in payment of it under section 10(4), be paid by the person on whose application the receiver was appointed.
